conditions.name: SRC Safety Review for Titration
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee must review available safety data before dose titration.
conditions.text: SRC will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Dose Modification for Neutropenia
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to low neutrophil count.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline.

conditions.name: Dose Modification for Liver Injury
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to potential liver injury.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3x ULN.

conditions.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to neurologic worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment.

conditions.name: Dose Modification for Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to psychiatric worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Intervention Discontinuation Criteria
conditions.description: Conditions requiring permanent discontinuation of the study intervention.
conditions.text: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

conditions.name: Rechallenge Limit
conditions.description: The maximum number of times a participant can be rechallenged with the study drug after a dose interruption.
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

transitionRules.name: Enrollment
transitionRules.text: Participants who sign ICF, are eligible, and are registered on Day -7 are considered enrolled.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day and increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29, pending SRC safety review.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN and ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for reasons including serious hypersensitivity, severe infection, disallowed medication, or pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Post-Study Therapy Transition
transitionRules.text: Following completion of the study (ie, Day 40), participants will transition to prior therapy, other standard of care, or request continuation of ALXN1840.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure (EOS Visit on Day 54 +/- 2 days).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered lost to follow-up if they repeatedly fail to return for visits and are unable to be contacted after documented attempts (3 calls, 1 certified letter).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 29 to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, based on SRC safety review of data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decisions to modify, interrupt, or reduce dose based on safety monitoring for hematology, liver function, neurologic, and psychiatric events.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Intervention Discontinuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to permanently discontinue a participant from the study intervention based on specific safety criteria.
